messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Rehearsal: Was  Peaceful Parenting
messages.msgSnippet: ... this ... Sounds really cool.  I m going to have a look and listen. ... I play French horn.  One orchestra I m in gives 4 concerts a year.  Another one
messages.messageBody:
>
> I had a performance tonight (Saturday) with my group GaiaWolf. It's more
> of a mixed bag of genres from world music to R&B to reggae to contemporary
> acoustic. GaiaWolf's mission has to do with promoting universal harmony
> amongst species, so to that end we sing about wolves in Yellowstone, how
> drought in the Serengeti affects the elephants who live there, peace, the
> manatee, pilot whales, starting over, what the Statue of Liberty might say
> if she could talk and tell us what she's been seeing, and on and on. If
> you'd like to hear some of the music we do, you can listen for free at
this
> website: http://artists.mp3s.com/artists/192/ec_lorick__gaiawolf.html My
> most favorite tune on there is Abby, Stay.

Sounds really cool. I'm going to have a look and listen.
>
> What's your instrument, Tia? Do you perform often?

I play French horn. One orchestra I'm in gives 4 concerts a year. Another
one gives a big concert in June and 3 chamber concerts during the spring.
This year I'm going to be in all of those. They're also doing a Christmas
concert, but I'm not in that one. The concert Friday night was with a
chamber orchestra that's usually just strings. We did a Mozart divertimento
for 2 horns and strings.

What do you do with Gaia Wolf? Play something? Sing?
Tia
